text: Guyuron, chair of plastic surgery at University Hospitals Case Medical Center in Cleveland, went on to identify four common "trigger sites" and publish studies showing that, in selected patients, surgical decompression of nerves in one or more of these sites provides lasting migraine relief. He has also taught 250 plastic surgeons around the world (none in the Philadelphia area) to perform the outpatient operation, which costs an average of $10,000 and is not covered by many insurers.
title: Surgery for migraines: Help or hokum?

meta_data.description: A dozen years ago, a patient told plastic surgeon Bahman Guyuron that her forehead lift also ended her migraine headaches, something that decades of drugs and lifestyle changes had failed to do.
